page.title: 11Mechanics Institute,Bradford
page.content: The Mechanics Institute was opened in 1869.It was opened to further the education of the working man and contained a reading room and a library. The reading room was open from 8am until 10pm and any member reading aloud or causing a nuisance was fined 1 penny.No member could keep a paper longer than 10 minutes if another member wanted it. During the 1910s and 20s it was used as a cinema.One of the films shown was "Alkali Ike's Mother-in-Law".People were asked not to "whistle,stamp or shout".It was recently used as a store for Bradford's museum service. It is now a community centre where there are clubs for all ages,including a youth club,over 60s club and keep fit.Shoppers can call in for coffee.
